snippet: As Israel strikes the Gaza Strip, President Mohamed Morsi faces pressure from Egyptians to support the Palestinians and from Western powers to uphold the peace treaty with Israel.
abstract: Escalating conflict in Gaza has confronted Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi with test of his conflicting commitments to fellow Islamists of militant group Hamas and to Egypt's landmark peace agreement with Israel.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: As Israel strikes the Gaza Strip, President Mohamed Morsi faces pressure from Egyptians to support the Palestinians and from Western powers to uphold the peace treaty with Israel.

headline.seo: Israeli Attacks Are Test of Loyalty for Egypt’s Morsi
headline.main: With Gaza Attacks, Egypt’s President Balances Hamas Against Israeli Peace
headline.print_headline: With Gaza Attacks, Egypt’s President Balances Hamas Against Israeli Peace
